meanings.definition: To make someone very angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: His constant teasing was enraging her.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site was enraging the neighbors.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy found it enraging to steal socks and run around the house.
meanings.sent4: The unfair treatment of the employees was enraging like a storm brewing in the office.
meanings.sent5: The betrayal felt like a fire of enraging emotions burning within her.

meanings.definition: Causing someone to become very angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: The enraging behavior of the bullies made the students feel unsafe.
meanings.sent2: The enraging news of the price increase upset many customers.
meanings.sent3: The enraging traffic jam turned into a comedy of errors as people started dancing in their cars.
meanings.sent4: The enraging heat of the desert sun felt like a relentless enemy on their journey.
meanings.sent5: The enraging sight of the littered park left a lasting impression on the visitors.
